title: Joseph Wilson, US diplomat caught up in a scandal over false intelligence in the run-up to the invasion of Iraq – obituary
text:
Joseph Wilson, who has died of organ failure aged 69, was the retired US ambassador whose public criticism of President George W Bush, for “twisting” pre-war intelligence about Saddam Hussein’s alleged weapons of mass destruction, set off a political scandal that led to the conviction of the vice-presidential aide Lewis “Scooter” Libby for lying to investigators and obstructing justice.

In February 2002 the CIA, at the behest of Vice President Dick Cheney, had dispatched Wilson, who had held senior positions in several African countries and had served as a diplomat in Baghdad, to Niger to investigate claims that the Iraqis had shopped there for “yellowcake” uranium ore that could be processed...
